column5: We go every year in late August to mid September but it's almost always just the old guys. Looking into doing a couple day fly-in with the outfitter we used to go through before we changed to a drive-in trip. Taking my brothers 14 year old and my 8 year old. Any tips or tricks on taking an 8 year old? Keeping him interested etc. No electricity and all that. It's only a couple days so I think we will be fine, but just curious. I'm assuming people have had experience taking young kids on a fly-in.Thanks

When I took my son when he was about that age we brought a wiffle ball and bat also taught him how to play cards. He never got board and was wore out by the end of the day. My son is 19 now and is going up with us this year for the first time in 5 years were both looking forward to it. Good luck and have fun.

Have had a bunch of younger kids in the boat,usually not to many problems,as long as there is action,i usually let them bring up the fish i hook,being on the water might be fun for you but not necessarily for some younger fisherman,goinh to shore once in a while doesnt hurt either
Try a 3 or 4 day trip at the Smoothrock Camp with Debbie Alexander. We've been going for years. The kids will get a discount. www.thunderhook.com
